intro: Pityrodia gilruthiana, commonly known as the Gilruth's mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or cream-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in heathland or open woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
